name: PyPIPackageInspector
description: Extracts comprehensive package information from PyPI and GitHub for quality evaluation. Provides detailed metrics on popularity (downloads, stars, forks), maintenance (release frequency, recent activity), documentation quality, Python version compatibility, and security indicators. Returns an overall quality score (0-100) with breakdown by category.

package_name.description: Name of the Python package to inspect on PyPI (e.g., 'requests', 'numpy', 'pandas')

include_github.description: Whether to fetch GitHub repository statistics (stars, forks, issues, last push). Requires package to have GitHub URL in metadata.

include_downloads.description: Whether to fetch download statistics from pypistats.org (downloads per day/week/month)

pypi_metadata.description: Complete PyPI metadata including version, author, license, dependencies, release history

overall_score.description: Weighted overall quality score combining all dimensions

popularity_score.description: Based on downloads, stars, forks, and release count

maintenance_score.description: Based on recent releases, GitHub activity, and update frequency

documentation_score.description: Based on docs URL, description length, and classifiers

compatibility_score.description: Based on wheel availability, Python version support

security_score.description: Based on license, maintenance status, and issue management

test_examples.description: Inspect the popular 'requests' HTTP library for quality metrics
Inspect NumPy with default settings (GitHub and downloads enabled)
Inspect Pandas with only PyPI metadata (faster, no external API calls)

metadata.author: ToolUniverse Team
use_cases: Evaluate package quality before adding as dependency
Compare alternative packages for similar functionality
Monitor package health and maintenance status
Generate package quality reports for documentation
